value.name: Isaiah Thomas says Celtics were sketchy in handling his 2017 hip injury
value.description: Isaiah Thomas was never the same player after his hip injury in 2017. Now he is calling out his team at the time for the way it handled the issue.The ex-All-Star appeared this week on Showtime’s “All The Smoke.

value.name: Isaiah Thomas reveals Celtics’ only wrongdoing during his tenure
value.description: The Boston Celtics held plenty of promise during Isaiah Thomas‘ peak. The diminutive point guard was a Most Valuable Player candidate while averaging 28.9 points per game in 2016-17. However, everything came to a halt no thanks to a hip injury that doomed the former All-Star’s career.

video.name: Isaiah Thomas Reveals Celtics' Only Wrongdoing During His Tenure

value.name: Isaiah Thomas Says Celtics Didn't Reveal Long-term Risk of 2017 Hip Injury
value.description: Isaiah Thomas believes the Boston Celtics should have been more up front with him about the 2017 hip injury that derailed his NBA career. The guard

value.name: City Council approves creation of new Citizens Police Oversight Commission
value.description: Philadelphia legislators have approved the creation of the Citizens Police Oversight Commission, sending the legislation to Mayor Jim Kenney.

value.name: Your Morning Dump... Where we shouldn't shoot the messenger but we probably will

value.name: Tatum’s 50 points carry Celtics over Nets 125-119
value.description: Bottled up in Brooklyn, Jayson Tatum came home and showed off an array of drives, step-back jumpers and 3-pointers. When Tatum was done, he had one of the best playoff games in Celtics

value.name: Philadelphia police budget cuts sought by 4 councilmembers during week of riots, looting: report
value.description: Katherine Gilmore Richardson and Isaiah Thomas – pledged their support for police cuts and other changes during an online call with local political activists, the Philadelphia Inquirer reported.

value.name: No. 1 Arkansas Calls the (Kevin) Kopps and Defeats No. 3 Vanderbilt 6-4 in Third Round of SEC Tournament
value.description: Arkansas got a big game from Kevin Kopps and some timely hitting to take a 6-4 win over Vanderbilt Thursday night in the third round of the SEC Tournament. Kopps worked 3.0 innings, struck out five, didn’t allow a hit or walk,

value.name: Liberty City is rapidly transforming. Residents are split on who will benefit.
value.description: Following Terrence “Uncle Tee” Smith through the streets of Liberty Square is like a master class in being a hometown hero. Drivers beep as he cruises by on his bike, one hand on the handle bars, the other holding a brown bagged Corona.

value.name: Israeli-Palestinian conflict tests relationship between Black, Jewish Miamians
value.description: Phillip Agnew's 2015 trip to Palestine forever changed his view of conflict in the Middle East. There, the prominent Miami-based social justice advocate saw what he describes as "cold, calculating racism and ethnic cleansing" by the Israeli government: checkpoints that divided mosques;
